content.question: ​An open-top box is constructed by cutting squares that are <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> inches by <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> inches from the corners of an <math alttext="11.2"><mn>11.2</mn></math>-inch by <math alttext="13.3"><mn>13.3</mn></math>-inch rectangular piece of cardboard, and then folding the sides of the box up to make walls. The volume of the box is modeled by the function <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> given by <math alttext="V open parentheses x close parentheses equals 4 x cubed minus 49 x squared plus 148.96 x"><mi>V</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>49</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>148.96</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. Which of the following statements is true about the function <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> ?

choices.label: ​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> to <math alttext="0 less than x less than 13.3"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>13.3</mn></math>, and the relative maximum value of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> on this domain is <math alttext="2724.106"><mn>2724.106</mn></math>. This is because the longer side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

​The contextual situation restricts the domain of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> to <math alttext="0 less than x less than 11.2"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>11.2</mn></math>, and the relative maximum value of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> on this domain is <math alttext="1141.504"><mn>1141.504</mn></math>. This is because the shorter side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

​​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> to <math alttext="0 less than x less than 6.65"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6.65</mn></math>, and the relative maximum value of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> on this domain is <math alttext="133.929"><mn>133.929</mn></math>. This is because half of the longer side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> to <math alttext="0 less than x less than 5.6"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5.6</mn></math>, and the relative maximum value of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> on this domain is <math alttext="133.929"><mn>133.929</mn></math>. This is because half of the shorter side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

content.answer: ​​The contextual situation restricts the domain of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> to <math alttext="0 less than x less than 5.6"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5.6</mn></math>, and the relative maximum value of <math alttext="V"><mi>V</mi></math> on this domain is <math alttext="133.929"><mn>133.929</mn></math>. This is because half of the shorter side of the cardboard determines the domain restriction.

topic.text: 1.13: Function Model Selection and Assumption Articulation

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
